snippet: A state with deep conservative and independent streaks has also been the site of two of the nation’s most notorious mass shootings, one in 1999 and one last summer.
abstract: Colorado's House of Representatives gives initial approval to legislation requiring background checks on private gun sales and placing limits on ammunition magazines; measures are being watched nationally by advocates on both sides of issue; state has lived under shadow of two of nation's worst mass shootings.
lead_paragraph: A state with deep conservative and independent streaks has also been the site of two of the nation’s most notorious mass shootings, one in 1999 and one last summer.

headline.seo: Gun Control Laws Clear Initial Hurdle in Colorado
headline.main: Stronger Gun-Control Measures Clear First Votes in the Colorado House
headline.print_headline: Stronger Gun-Control Measures Clear First Votes in the Colorado House
